news.title: It's Dubai calling for flexible office providers, fund houses
news.para: Indian businesses are increasingly choosing Dubai for expansion. Flexible workspace provider CorporatEdge and fund house Nisus Finance Services Company Limited have made significant investments. Dubai's investor-friendly policies, tax-free environment, and Golden Visa program make it attractive. This offers Indian companies a compelling alternative for global growth and investment.

news.title: Five sub-registrars suspended after 1,332 illegal property registrations in Bengaluru
news.para: A major property registration scam has been uncovered in Bengaluru, leading to the suspension of five sub-registrars. Over 1,300 properties were allegedly registered fraudulently using the e-khata system by bypassing mandatory e-khata details from the e-swathu software. The investigation was triggered by a complaint from the Centre for Smart Governance.

news.title: Kerala’s policy reversal set to legitimise land-use violations
news.para: Land-use violations in Idukki, previously pursued with public resources and legal action, are now at risk of retrospective legitimization under a new policy.  These widespread breaches, involving resorts, commercial establishments, and party offices on government and restricted lands, could be nullified, undermining years of enforcement efforts.

news.title: Noida authority sets up panel to clear backlog of sub-lease deeds
news.para: Noida Authority has formed an eight-member committee to resolve long-standing issues concerning the non-registration of tripartite sub-lease deeds for flats in cooperative housing societies. This move aims to regularize registrations for subsequent buyers and address revenue losses from unpaid stamp duty, potentially leading to a uniform policy.

news.title: About 29 illegal colonies in Baghpat served notices; bulldozer action planned
news.para: Baghpat authorities have issued notices to 29 illegal colonies and a private school for unauthorized constructions. The school faces scrutiny for building without mandatory approvals, with demolition action threatened if violations aren't rectified. This drive aims to curb illegal constructions that hinder planned development and public safety.

news.title: Bengaluru development body asks Gunjur society to form an RWA within one week
news.para: BDA notice directing formation of residents’ association within one week amidst lack of clarity on guidelines or registering authority leaves homeowners confused. Residents of BDA‑developed apartment complex say property still has pending work and various maintenance issues including lack of functioning lift, while urging authorities to look into matter

news.title: Kerala plans blockchain, other reforms to secure land transactions: CM
news.para: Kerala is gearing up to bolster the security of land transactions through innovative measures. By harnessing blockchain technology, the government aims to eliminate fraud and curb duplicate registrations. Soon, residents can enjoy an array of services right from their homes, minimizing the need for office visits.

news.title: Nagpur Metro's phase III to be extended to New Nagpur and beyond Butibori MIDC
news.para: Nagpur Metro's Phase 3 expansion is set to extend significantly beyond its initial scope, with plans now including a route to New Nagpur and an additional 5km stretch past Butibori MIDC. This expansion aims to bolster connectivity to emerging residential and industrial hubs, broadening the city's mass transit network.

news.title: ED submits charge sheet in ₹145-crore illegal sand mining case
news.para: The Enforcement Directorate has filed a charge sheet in a special CBI court regarding illegal sand mining in Bengal, revealing financial irregularities amounting to nearly Rs 145 crore. The probe implicates 14 companies and four individuals, including businessman Arun Saraf, who allegedly conducted transactions indirectly.  Sand stocks were verified across 13 locations.

news.title: CRDA unit offices set up for Amaravati land pooling phase II
news.para: Amaravati's land pooling gears up for its second phase, with unit offices establishing in villages across Guntur and Palnadu districts. Meanwhile, construction of residential buildings for officials and public representatives is nearing completion, with many expected to be handed over by April. The seed access road land acquisition is also set to begin.

news.title: Can’t alter common area minus nod of two-third residents: WBREAT
news.para: West Bengal Real Estate Appellate Tribunal upheld RERA's order restraining promoters from dealing with 'Atmosphere' project assets. The tribunal ruled that promoters must obtain prior written consent from two-thirds of allottees before modifying sanctioned plans. The Kolkata Municipal Corporation was directed to inspect the site for compliance.

news.title: ED attaches assets worth ₹100 crore of Amrapali Group
news.para: The ED has provisionally attached immovable properties worth Rs 100 crore belonging to Mauria Udyog, an Amrapali Group entity, in a money laundering case. This action stems from allegations of fraudulent diversion of homebuyers' funds, with Rs 110.39 crore confirmed to have been routed to Mauria Udyog. The total attached properties in the case now amount to Rs 303 crore.

news.title: Sobha's sales bookings jump 52% to ₹2,115 crore in Q3 FY26
news.para: Sobha's sales bookings surged 52% to Rs 2,115 crore in the third quarter. This growth was driven by higher volumes and improved price realization. The company sold properties worth Rs 1,388 crore in the same period last year.

news.title: Goa: Town planning department opens green areas in Calangute, Anjuna for settlement
news.para: Goa's town and country planning department has approved land conversions in Calangute, Para, Anjuna, and Aldona. Over 35,000 square meters of orchards and natural cover will become settlement zones. Many areas are ecologically sensitive and in demand by developers. The department issued a gazette notification, allowing 30 days for objections before final recommendations are sent to the state government.

news.title: Seven landlords booked for violating tenant verification guidelines in Jammu
news.para: The Jammu and Kashmir Police have taken action against seven landlords in Jammu for neglecting tenant verification protocols. This enforcement, following directives from the District Magistrate, has resulted in several FIRs filed at Bahu Fort and Channi Himmat police stations.

news.title: Delhi: DDA launches second phase of 'Towering Heights' project
news.para: The Delhi Development Authority is rolling out the second phase of its ambitious Karkardooma housing scheme. With 741 flats available to eager homebuyers on a first-come, first-served basis, registrations kick off on January 8.

news.title: Six get commercial plots at sector 7 under land pooling in Pithampur
news.para: MPIDC has allotted land to six owners under the land pooling scheme for Sector 7 industrial belt development in Pithampur. This process involved 47 commercial plots valued at Rs 47 crore, with remaining compensation to be settled through residential plot allotments. The initiative aims for fair compensation and planned industrial development.
